The game is pretty cool, but the match making is non existent. Every single match, if I am a Survivor I go with pros and against a killer that has rank 3 perks, fully unlocked slots, and knows the maps inside and out, and here I am with my 1 rank 1 perk. I generally don't get very far because everyone is 5 ranks higher than me. The game's concept is great, but playing against survivors with way more game experience than you, or playing against a professional killer, just ticks me off seriously that this game is not new player friendly.

Update: 2020
They said they're renewing the Matchmaking, but all that results in now is waiting even longer for a match, and still get matched with people easily 15 ranks above my own with a full roster of level 3 perks. Great job.

I see survivor matchmaking is not too bad, but killer matchmaking is terrible. I have 1 level 1 perk, going up against a full roster of survivors with full rank 3 perks. Two years later, SAME ISSUE. Clearly the matchmaking post they made was a waste of my time.

EDIT: Tried again after nearly a year of giving up on this game. And the matchmaking is as terrible as I remember. I have now grown to despise this game.

Decent game, sadly not balanced for the top % players. 
The devs focus on survivors' QOL over killers' most of the time and take literal years to fix broken shit (like DS) for surv side and months for killer side (ruin + undying). That said, it's still decently fun as long as you don't find sweaty red bull chugging kids (on either side).
Playing SWF to fuck around and eventually bully the killer is fun.
Survivors have plenty of choice for builds that change aspects of the average playstyle, and many of which are viable even in gimmicky.

A game with so much potential and addictive, but yet so broken with bugs, unbalanced perks and addons for both sides, filled    with toxic players who abuse these broken features. DBD is a great game if you got a relaxed mind as many of the streamers, but you will need breaks from it, else you will grow tired of the growing population of ..... well toxic players who most likely turned toxic due to playing against a toxic player earlier. 

Even tho i still love the game, but i do not recommend buying it untill devs get their hands on and start fixing the core game, find a way to establish a positive community perhaps by removing some few features, instead of launching everlasting DLC's.

Bought this when it came out and played a couple of hours with all characters, didn't enjoy it back then. Tried again 2 years later and started liking the game a bit more but the free characters weren't my thing. After buying Feng Min purely for the model I found her playstyle what I was looking for and my performance actually Sky Rocketed, went from rank 20 to 15 in around 8 hours of gameplay. around 80% surviving success.

I have a problem of buying good games when they launch and only grab them years later, at least I grab them before they're dead...

The game is fun and I recommend it.
